questions.question: What type of correlation would you expect between the amount of time spent studying and exam scores?
What is the probability of drawing an Ace from a well shuffled standard deck of 52 cards?
In a hypothesis test, what does a Type II error represent?
options: Failing to reject a false null hypothesis
Failing to reject a true null hypothesis
questions.correct_answer: Failing to reject a false null hypothesis

questions.question: In a binomial distribution, what does the 'n' parameter represent?
Which measure of central tendency is most suitable for skewed data?
What does the Central Limit Theorem state?
options: The mean of a large number of independent and identically distributed random variables tends to be normally distributed
The sum of a large number of independent and identically distributed random variables tends to be normally distributed
The variance of a large number of independent and identically distributed random variables tends to be normally distributed
Both the mean and sum of a large number of independent and identically distributed random variables tend to be normally distributed
questions.correct_answer: Both the mean and sum of a large number of independent and identically distributed random variables tend to be normally distributed

questions.question: What does a negative value for skewness imply?
options: The distribution is negatively skewed, with the tail on the left side of the distribution
The distribution is positively skewed, with the tail on the right side of the distribution
questions.correct_answer: The distribution is negatively skewed, with the tail on the left side of the distribution

questions.question: What is the interquartile range of the following data set: 2, 5, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24?
If two dice are rolled, what is the probability of the sum of the numbers on the top faces being 7?
Which statistical test would you use to compare the means of two related groups?
